answers.answer: If you look in theNeurology Community and find the question on periventricular small vessel ischemic changes By Deb2136 dated Nov 01, 2007A doctor gives her reply dated 3 November 2007.
I hope that your wife is okay!!!  That is one big, bad word and sounds quite scary.  I will keep her in my thoughts! - Blu

At first I thought it was one long word, bit it is actually should read:-mild confluent and discrete chronic ischemic foci in bilateral corona radiataThis is to do with the white matter in the brain.Is your wife experiencing headaches, has had uncontrolled high blood pressure, altzheimers, neurological problems that are affecting her limbs, multiple sceloris, clogged up veins, diabetes?  Has your wife experienced a stroke?The condition can happen slowly due to old age.Chronic means long term, that the condition has been present for a long time.

question: mywife has undergone mri brain the repot says mildconfluentanddiscretechronicischemicfociinbilaterelcoronaradiata
title: chronicischemicfoci
